Description: Baker Hughes Incorporated  agreed to pay more than $23 million in disgorgement and prejudgment interest and a civil penalty of $10 million to settle allegations that it violated a 2001 cease-and-desist Order prohibiting violations of the books and records and internal controls provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2007/2007-77.htm

Company: Baker Hughes Oil Field Operations Inc.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 213112: Support Activities for Oil and Gas Operations
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Baker Hughes Services International Inc. pleaded guilty to violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Its parent company Baker Hughes simultaneously entered into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2007/April/07_crm_296.html

Contained in data received from the agency on February 25, 2021 in response to an open records request.
